thread.title: 'Star Wars' movie tickets on sale Monday
thread.title_full: 'Star Wars' movie tickets on sale Monday - CNN.com

author: THR Staff
title: 'Star Wars' movie tickets on sale Monday
text:
Story highlights New artwork was also released for the film set to hit theaters on Dec. 18. (The Hollywood Reporter) Not all Star Wars fans will have to wait in line for tickets.
Lucasfilm announced on Sunday that advance ticket sales and a new trailer for the J.J. Abrams-directed film, "Star Wars: The Force Awakens," will arrive on Monday Oct.19. The trailer will air during ESPN's Monday Night Football game between the New York Giants and the Philadelphia Eagles.
Read more: 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' sets world premiere date and city
Disney announced in a statement that following the launch of the trailer, tickets will be sold everywhere movie tickets are sold. Both Lucasfilm and ESPN are owned by The Walt Disney Co.
Read more: Box Office: 'Goosebumps' out-spooks 'Bridge of Spies,' 'Crimson Peak' with $23.5M
Read More To celebrate the news, the "Star Wars" official Twitter account tweeted a new poster for the film, confirming that fans will get to see a new trailer starring Daisy Ridley, Oscar Isaac and John Boyega, along with the return of original "Star Wars" stars Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Mark Hamill, Anthony Daniels and Peter Mayhew.
Check out the new official poster! Tune in to @ESPN 's Monday Night Football for a new look at #TheForceAwakens . pic.twitter.com/NTRWLlVyID
— Star Wars (@starwars) October 18, 2015 New teaser clips have now been released ahead of the trailer's Monday debut with the caption: "The Resistance gathers tomorrow." The clips feature glimpses of the main protagonists played by Ridley, Isaac and Boyega.
Read more: Kaley Cuoco channels Luke Skywalker in 'Star Wars'-themed outing to win charity event
Watch the clips below.
The Resistance gathers tomorrow. Watch @ESPN 's Monday Night Football for a new look at #TheForceAwakens .
 https://t.co/Ft8vVg26VG
— Star Wars (@starwars) October 18, 2015 TOMORROW #TheForceAwakens
 https://t.co/GcFzg2MiPr
— Walt Disney Studios (@DisneyStudios) October 18, 2015 "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" makes a wide debut in theaters on Dec. 18.
